title: Jesse Ventura - Wikipedia
snippet: Initially ignored as a novelty ... fights for control over the party, Ventura left the Reform Party a year after taking office and served the remainder of his term as a member of the Independence Party of Minnesota....

title: Governorship of Jesse Ventura | MNopedia
snippet: The former Reform Party, now the Independence Party, loses major-party status. Frank, Stephen I., and Steven Charles Wagner. We Shocked the World! A Case Study of Jesse Ventura’s Election as Governor of Minnesota.

title: Jesse Ventura - Ballotpedia
snippet: Ventura ran for governor of Minnesota in 1998. Ventura was elected as a member of the Reform Party, but later left and reorganized the Minnesota Reform Party as the Independence Party.[1] He did not seek a second term as governor.[2]

title: Jesse Ventura | Research Starters | EBSCO Research
snippet: During the 1990s, Ventura became increasingly involved in state politics. He joined the Minnesota Independence Party (later affiliated with H. Ross Perot as the Minnesota Reform Party) and supported MIP candidate Dean Barkley for the US Senate.

title: Jesse Ventura | Biography & Facts | Britannica
snippet: His first foray into politics was as mayor of Brooklyn Park (1991–95). In the late 1990s he worked as a radio shock jock. ... In 1998 Ventura ran for governor of Minnesota as the Reform Party candidate.
